snippet: Pope Benedict XVI appointed Gerhard Ludwig Müller, the bishop of Regensburg, Germany, to lead the office, which is responsible for enforcing orthodoxy.
abstract: Pope Benedict XVI appoints a fellow German theologian, Bishop Gerhard Ludwig Muller, to lead the Vatican’s Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith, which is responsible for enforcing orthodoxy; Bishop Muller, will also oversee a continuing investigation of the social justice work of nuns in the United States as well as the handling of clerical sexual abuse cases; he is simultaneously promoted to archbishop.
